author: p0W3RH311
body:
commit 8cec8f150da7583b7af5efbe2853efee0179750c

When you use a regular expression with capture groups it will set the global variable $1 to the first group, $2 for the second group, etc. 

for example:
```

function match ($str,$rx) 
{
   $x = [regex]$rx
   $p = $x.matches($str)
   if($p.groups.count -gt 1) 
   {
       $gcount = $p.groups.count - 1
       for($i=1; $i -le $gcount; $i++)
       {
           new-variable -name $i -value $p.groups[$i].value -scope 1 -force
       }
   }
   elseif($p.groups.count -eq 1)
   {
       $p.value
   }
}
```

```
PS C:\> match -str 'hello world' -rx '^(\w+) (\w+)$'
PS C:\> $1
hello
PS C:\> $2
world
PS C:\>
```
